metadata.title: CVE-2022-20153 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In rcu_cblist_dequeue of rcu_segcblist.c, there is a possibleuse-after-free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalationof privilege in the kernel with System execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-222091980References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20153` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
